metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36152 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in readDataVar in hdf/dataobject.c in Symonics libmysofa0.5 - 1.1 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted SOFA.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysofa-utils - 1.2~dfsg0-1
libmysofa1 - 1.2~dfsg0-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libmysofa package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2~dfsg0-1').
